questions.text: A man presents with multiple lesions on his face and upper back, diagnosed as acne vulgaris. Which of the following is the most effective treatment for his symptoms?
A 42-year-old man comes with vesicular eruptions in the buccal mucosa. Direct immunofluorescence is done and the image is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following causes the condition shown in the image below?

45 year old man came with complaints of tearing chest pain, tachycardia, and hypotension with negative Trop I and T. The wall of the aorta was biopsied and the image is shown below. What is the most likely pathology behind it?

options.label: A
options.text: Connective tissue damage of the aortic wall

options.label: B
options.text: Fibrinoid necrosis and smooth muscle hyperplasia

options.label: C
options.text: Fat deposition and smooth muscle degeneration

questions.correct_answer: A. Connective tissue damage of the aortic wall

questions.text: A male patient presents with headaches and visual disturbance. The patient had frontal bossing, thick palms, and soles, and gaping of central incisors. He is also hypertensive and diabetic. Which of the following statements is true about screening investigations done on this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: GH levels <0.4 after 1 hour of 75 gm glucose tolerance test.

options.label: B
options.text: Single early morning fasting level of GH is used to establish the diagnosis.

options.label: C
options.text: Age specific IGF-1 levels are useful for screening.

options.label: D
options.text: GH levels are used to assess the severity of the condition.

questions.correct_answer: C. Age specific IGF-1 levels are useful for screening.

questions.text: A 40-year-old female patient known case of myasthenia gravis on mycophenolate mofetil and pyridostigmine now presents with breathing difficulties. Her calcium levels were 13.5g/dl. What is the most likely cause for the increase in calcium?
A person goes through routine tests while applying for a job. His ECG showed a PR interval of 0.21 sec. What is the diagnosis?
A 36-year-old girl presented with tremors and weight loss. Her ophthalmic examination shows the following findings. Identify the true statement regarding the following condition.

options.label: B
options.text: Medial rectus is the first muscle to be involved.

options.label: C
options.text: The muscles and connective tissue around the eye shares similar antigen with diseased organ

questions.correct_answer: C. The muscles and connective tissue around the eye shares similar antigen with diseased organ

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman came with complaints of weakness, lethargy, and heavy menstrual bleeding. Her peripheral blood picture showed small RBCs with pallor. Lab investigations are given below. What is the diagnosis?
Which of the following is most likely diagnosis based on the lab values given? Blood. pH: 7.3 Na+: 134 mEq/L K+: 2.8mEq/L Cl. 113mEq/L HCO3- 12mEq/L BUN: 3mg/dL Creatinine: 0.6mg/dL Urinary pH: 9.4
A patient after RTA underwent ileal resection. He presents with fatigue, which of the following will not be seen?
Which among the following statements is true regarding PNH?

options.label: A
options.text: Anemia with heart failure is the most common cause of mortality

options.label: D
options.text: Flow cytometry is the gold standard for diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: D. Flow cytometry is the gold standard for diagnosis

questions.text: Identify pseudomembranous colitis from the given image.

A patient gives a history of epigastric pain radiating to the back for five days. Lab investigations show that amylase and lipase are elevated five times the normal values. Two litres of saline was administered in 24 hours to the patient. He also gave a history of consumption of alcohol. Given below is the chest X-ray of the patient. What is the most probable diagnosis?

A young athlete presented with chest pain and dyspnea. His brother passed away due to sudden cardiac death. He is diagnosed with HCM. A harsh systolic murmur is heard in the left sternal border. Which of the following will increase the murmur? HCM-Hypertrophic Cardiomyopathy

A young man had a history of jaundice and raised HBsAg levels a year back. On follow-up now, he has normal levels of liver enzymes. His current profile is shown in the image. What is the diagnosis for his current condition?

options.label: A
options.text: Chronic HepB with HBe Ag negative

options.label: C
options.text: Chronic HepB with HBe Ag positive

questions.correct_answer: C. Chronic HepB with HBe Ag positive

questions.text: A 35-year-old female with a history of hypertension presents with palpitations, dyspnea, bilateral basal crackles and irregularly irregular pulse. ECG is given below. Which among the following management is least useful?

options.label: A
options.text: Cardioversion in a haemodynamically unstable patient

options.label: C
options.text: Beta blockers is to be given for rate control if patient Is intolerant to Calcium channel blockers

options.label: D
options.text: IV digoxin for ventricular rate control

questions.correct_answer: C. Beta blockers is to be given for rate control if patient Is intolerant to Calcium channel blockers

questions.text: A woman presented with an irregularly irregular rhythm with a heart rate of 150 bpm. On auscultation P2 was loud and no murmur was heard. What would be the JVP finding?

A 45 year old woman came with complaints of fever, night sweats, generalised itching and unintentional weight loss of 10% in the last 3 months. On examination, she has enlarged cervical and axillary lymph nodes. The lymph node examination and biopsy showed the following picture. What would the likely diagnosis and treatment option be?

options.label: B
options.text: Non Hogkins Lymphoma – Poor prognosis due to advanced stage – treated with radiotherapy

questions.text: What is the most likely cause of death in a patient suffering from Idiopathic pulmonary fibrosis?

A 35-year-old man presented with high fever, bleeding gums, myalgia, and hepatosplenomegaly. His TLC is 3100, Hb-11 g/dl, hematocrit- 55%, and platelets – 25,000 cells. What is the most important prognostic factor in this condition?
The following MRI image shows a malignancy. What is the visual field defect observed in this case?
The patient presented with alcoholic gait, and abnormal eye movements (nystagmus) after RTA. Which lobe of the cerebellum is likely affected?
A patient presented to the OPD with a temperature of 102°F, and a cough with foul-smelling sputum. On examination, clubbing is present. His chest X-ray is given below. What is the probable diagnosis?
A patient presented with right upper and lower limb weakness with left sided facial nerve palsy and left sided horizontal gaze palsy. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 37-year-old woman from Bihar presents with fever and unexplained weight loss over the past 6 months. Examination reveals massive splenomegaly and blood investigations show anemia, thrombocytopenia, and hypergammaglobulinemia. What is the vector of the organism causing this condition?
An HIV patient developed a fever and dry cough. He was diagnosed with TB. He is currently on Lamivudine, Zidovudine and Nevirapine. Which Anti-TB drug should be changed in this patient?
A female suffered a head injury from a road traffic accident. On examination, there is elevated intracranial pressure. Which diuretic among the following can be used in her condition?

A 25-year-old male presents with hyperthermia, autonomic instability, confusion, hyperreflexia, muscle rigidity, and dilated pupils. The patient takes sertraline and was recently prescribed amitryptiline and sumatriptan for depression and migraines, respectively. Which medication is most likely to be effective in treating this patient’s current condition?
A patient is started on a 3 HP TPT (Tuberculosis Preventative Therapy) regimen. Which of the following is true regarding the regimen?

options.label: A
options.text: There is more compliance in 3HP than 9H and 6H

options.label: C
options.text: Chance of abortion in 3 HP is same as 6H

options.label: D
options.text: 3HP regimen is less effective than 6H and 9H in preventing active TB

questions.correct_answer: A. There is more compliance in 3HP than 9H and 6H

questions.text: A middle-aged man presented to the OPD with dysuria and purulent urethral discharge for the last 3 days. Gram stain of the discharge is shown below. He admits to having unprotected sexual intercourse one week ago. What is the most appropriate treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: Tab. Acyclovir 500 mg TDS for 1 week

options.label: B
options.text: Tab. Doxycycline 100 mg BD for 14 days

options.label: D
options.text: Inj. Benzathaine Penicillin 2.4 MU IM Stat

questions.text: The drug ‘X’ is a GHRH analogue that is FDA-approved for the treatment of HIV-associated lipodystrophy and not used for Growth hormone deficiency. Identify the drug ‘X’. GHRH-Growth Hormone Releasing Hormone
Which of the following reasons best explains the combination of Atropine (0.025 mg) and Diphenoxylate (2.5 mg) for treating secretory diarrhoea?

options.label: A
options.text: Atropine potentiates the action of smooth muscle relaxation

options.label: B
options.text: It prevents overdose and abuse of Diphenoxylate

options.label: C
options.text: It antagonizes the side effect of Diphenoxylate

options.label: D
options.text: Atropine increases the antimotility action of diphenoxylate

questions.correct_answer: B. It prevents overdose and abuse of Diphenoxylate

questions.text: A hypertensive patient is started on a drug to control his BP. He had complaints of dry mouth, drowsiness, and confusion after taking this drug, but he still continued to take the drug for 1 year. He had to travel abroad for work, and he forgot to take his medications. He now presents with a blood pressure of 200/120mmHg. Identify the drug he was on?
Which of the following drugs when added with erythromycin can lead to torsades de pointes?

A chronic alcoholic met with a vehicular accident. His blood alcohol level is >300 mg/dl. He needs hospitalization and will be withheld from taking alcohol. The drug that will be used to manage his withdrawal symptoms is:
A child was started on ciclesonide inhalational therapy for bronchial asthma. Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding his treatment?

options.label: A
options.text: It has fewer side effects compared to other inhalational steroids

options.label: B
options.text: It is a prodrug metabolised by bronchial esterase

options.label: C
options.text: The occurrence of oral candidiasis is more compared to other inhaled steroids

questions.correct_answer: C. The occurrence of oral candidiasis is more compared to other inhaled steroids

questions.text: A patient diagnosed with hypertriglyceridemia was started on a medication, following which, he developed flushing, hyperglycemia, and elevated liver enzymes. Identify the drug consumed by the patient.
In which phase of clinical trials is drug dosing done?

A 32-year-old woman diagnosed with diarrhoeapredominant irritable bowel syndrome presented to the casualty with severe abdominal pain. She was prescribed a drug that exerts a direct spasmolytic effect on the smooth muscles of the gastrointestinal tract. Which drug could it be?
Which of the following options best defines the correct sequence of the phases of the demographic cycle?

options.label: A
options.text: High expanding – Early stationary – Late expanding - Low stationary – Declining

options.label: B
options.text: High stationary – Early expanding – Late expanding - Low stationary – Declining

questions.correct_answer: B. High stationary – Early expanding – Late expanding - Low stationary – Declining

questions.text: Which of the following are not included in the School Health Programme under Ayushman Bharat?

options.label: A
options.text: Monthly IFA tablets for all children

questions.correct_answer: A. Monthly IFA tablets for all children

questions.text: Which of the following are components of the physical quality of life index (PQLI)? 1. Infant mortality rate 2. Life expectancy at birth 3. Literacy rate 4. Life expectancy at 1 year of age 5. Under 5 mortality rate
Which of the following is true about longevity dividend?

options.label: A
options.text: The intervention can delay the onset of the disease

options.label: B
options.text: Small amounts of damage is accumulated over time

options.label: C
options.text: The older you are the more prone you are to disease

options.label: D
options.text: Economic and health benefit for the society

questions.correct_answer: A. The intervention can delay the onset of the disease

questions.text: In a population of 30,000, there were 500 live births & 14 still births in the year 2023. There were 18 children that died before the age of 1 year, 12 before 28 days of life & among that, 9 died in the first 7 days of life. Calculate the early neonatal mortality rate?
Pick the correct statement regarding the Sanchol cholera vaccine

options.label: A
options.text: Bivalent vaccine given in 2 liquid doses orally to children >=1 year of age

options.label: B
options.text: Bivalent given in single dose orally to children >1 years of age

options.label: C
options.text: Monovalent given in 2 liquid doses orally with a bicarbonate buffer

options.label: D
options.text: Monovalent given in a single dose orally with a bicarbonate buffer

questions.correct_answer: B. Bivalent given in single dose orally to children >1 years of age

questions.text: The image shown corresponds to which health program and disease?

A study is investigating the relationship between diet and the incidence of a particular disease. Among 100 vegetarians, 30 individuals are found to have the disease, while among 100 non-vegetarians, 50 individuals are affected. Which biostatistical method is most appropriate to determine if there is no significant association between diet and disease incidence?

A hospital collected nasopharyngeal swabs from 1000 patients every day from the onset of the disease. The organism count was found to be maximum on the 5th day, which also showed the maximum infectivity (infecting 825 patients). What is this period of 5 days from the onset of the disease known as?

A man presents with sudden onset bilateral leg swelling, diarrhea, and difficulty breathing. He reports consuming mustard oil purchased from a local vendor prior to the onset of symptoms. A health inspector is investigating the cause of his condition. Which test is the most appropriate to detect the adulterant in the mustard oil?

A disease has an incubation period of 3-14 days. It has a median incubation of 10 days. A person had to travel abroad and he was not vaccinated. As the disease is of international significance, how long will he have to be quarantined?

In a town, there were 1000 live births in a period of 6 months. During the same period, 12 women died due to the following causes. What is the maternal mortality ratio? Sepsis-3 Road traffic accidents – 2 Obstructed labor – 2 Postpartum hemorrhage – 3 Snake bite-2
Which vaccine will be placed at zone 3 in the device shown below?
A child presented with failure to thrive and recurrent infections. On examination, tonsils are absent. Further evaluation confirms the deficiency of adenosine deaminase. What is the likely diagnosis?
An adult male presented with protruding abdomen, diarrhoea, visual symptoms and neurological manifestations. Based on the peripheral smear finding what is the likely diagnosis?

A middle aged man came with complaints of dyspnea, chest tightness and dry cough. On imaging, he was found to have diffuse interstitial fibrosis. The biopsy of his lung was taken and is shown below. Which of the following industries he has likely been working in for the last 20 years?

A 28 year old woman P1L1, came with complaints of weakness and generalised fatigue. The peripheral blood picture showed microcytic hypochromic anemia. Her serum iron was low and she had increased RDW. Her MCV and MCH were also low and TIBC was high. What would her serum transferrin saturation be?
Which method is more effective than measuring clotting factors for assessing the intrinsic pathway of coagulation?

A 72-year-old man came with generalised anascarca and icterus. He had hepatosplenomegaly. Kidney function tests were found to be deranged and his urine gammaglobulins were more than 3gm/dl. Electrophoresis of the urine protein is shown below. Which is the most likely diagnosis?

A 53-year-old woman came with complaints of fatigue, nausea, anasarca and proteinuria. She had anaemia and neutropenia. Her Bone marrow examination showed 22% plasma cells and acellular eosinophilic deposits. The bone marrow biopsy is shown below. What is the associated pathology?

options.label: D
options.text: Myxomatous degeneration of the bone marrow

questions.text: A 10-year-old boy comes with a fever and pain in his right upper limb. He has an expansile lesion in his right radius in the diaphysis. The histopathology of the lesion is shown below. What is the most accurate test among the following?

A 55-year-old obese woman with a history of diabetes and hypertension presents with postmenopausal bleeding. Endometrial sampling was performed and it revealed a positive result for PTEN, CTNNB1, KRAS, and MSI markers. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A patient presented with an arm span of more than height, a subluxated lens, and a pigeon chest appearance. What is the likely protein involved in this condition?

A patient passed away following a myocardial infarction. An autopsy was conducted and the biopsy findings of his cardiac tissue are shown below. What is the number of days since the injury, based on the given findings?

A 6-month-old child presented with leucocoria (cat’s eye reflex) in the right eye. A cranial pathology was detected. The lesion is positive for synaptophysin, NSE, and chromogranin, and shows a palisade in a spoke-and-wheel arrangement, surrounding a central core. Identify the condition. NSE-Neuron specific enolase

A patient complained of acute painful diminution of vision in the left eye for the past 2 days. On ophthalmic examination, circumcorneal congestion and irregularly shaped pupil were noted as shown below, with the left eye visual acuity at 6/60 and the right eye at 6/12. What is the probable diagnosis?
A 2-month-old girl child was brought to the hospital by her parents with the following presentation. What is the appropriate management?
Identify the defect shown in the image:

A patient wearing contact lenses develops pain in the orbital region. He has had a very casual attitude towards cleaning his contact lenses. He presented with corneal ulcer and keratitis. Scrapings showed an organism with a spine-like pseudopodia. Which organism is the likely cause of this patient’s symptoms?
Identify the visual field defect in the given image:

A patient who was watching a movie suddenly developed acute pain in the eye and diminution in vision. He was brought to the emergency department and on examination, a shallow anterior chamber was noted. What would be the appropriate management for this condition?
A patient diagnosed with HIV presents with complaints of recurrent diarrhoea. The stool sample reveals only larvae and no ova. Which of the following is the most probable causative organism?

A young man who has just returned from the USA develops fever, cough, and breathlessness. A chest radiograph shows bilateral hilar lymphadenopathy and mediastinal lymphadenopathy. Culture on Sabouraud Dextrose Agar (SDA) reveals white to light brown puffy colonies. Lactophenol blue staining shows the findings as depicted in the image. What is the most likely causative organism?

A middle-aged man presents with complaints of itching around the perianal region and unilateral lower limb lymphadenopathy. Larvae of approximately 200 microns in size were identified, and these larvae lacked nuclei at their tail tips. What is the most likely causative organism?

A 3-year-old boy had patches of partial hair loss with mild itching and scales. The picture of his scalp is shown below. His sister also has a similar condition. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

A middle-aged man with a history of unprotected sexual intercourse presents with complaints of painful urination and itching. On examination, Gram-negative intracellular cocci are observed. What is the most likely causative organism?

A group of hostel boys consumed hamburgers from a local street food shop following which they developed abdominal pain, diarrhoea, vomiting, and fever. They were diagnosed with hemolytic uremic syndrome (HUS). Escherichia coli 0157:H7 was detected in the stool samples and the ham. What does H represent in H7?

A young man presents with burning and painful micturition. Microscopy showed gram-negative intracellular kidney bean-shaped organisms. Which of the following culture media is used to isolate the organism?

A 22-year-old farmer develops an ulcer on his foot with a white powdery substance and multiple discharging sinuses. Microscopy reveals a gram-positive organism with radiating filaments. What is the most likely organism isolated from the discharging sinus?

An elderly female with a central line undergoes surgery. On postoperative day 3, she develops fever and tachycardia. A culture from the tip of the central line revealed brown buff colonies. Microscopy showed gram-positive organisms that reproduce by budding. What is the likely causative organism?

A 65-year-old treated leprosy patient came with complaints of a well-demarcated, non-tender ulcer on his foot with hyperkeratotic borders as given below for the last 3 months. What should be the appropriate next step?

options.label: B
options.text: Rest the limb, non weight bearing splints and foot care

options.label: C
options.text: Admit the patient and aggressive debridement and antibiotics

questions.correct_answer: B. Rest the limb, non weight bearing splints and foot care

questions.text: A patient presented to the casualty with chest pain and palpitations. His blood pressure was 130/90mmHg and pulse rate-101bpm. Echocardiography showed a collapse of the right atrium during diastole. What is the most appropriate management for this patient?
Identify the given drain.
A patient underwent surgery for a leg ulcer due to burns. What is the mechanism by which a graft receives its nutritional supply on postoperative day 3?

A male child experienced acute scrotal pain while playing. He was taken to the emergency department and a USG doppler was performed, followed by immediate surgical exploration. The following finding was seen. What is the probable diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Torsion of testicular appendage with Gangrene

questions.text: What is the ideal pressure exerted by the method of dressing for a non-healing leg ulcer shown below?

A 76 year old elderly man presents with confusion. He is on antihypertensive medication, and on aspirin after a recent MI. He recalls a trivial fall from chair 3 weeks ago. Other neurological examination was normal. What is the likely diagnosis?
A chronic tobacco chewer presented with an ulcerative-nodular lesion of 4x5 cm over the lip, as shown below. Which investigation would most likely confirm his diagnosis?

options.label: A
options.text: Superficial incisional biopsy along with normal tissue

options.label: B
options.text: Deep incisional biopsy of Ulcer along with normal tissue

options.label: C
options.text: Excisional biopsy along with normal tissue

questions.correct_answer: B. Deep incisional biopsy of Ulcer along with normal tissue

questions.text: A patient is diagnosed with Stanford type B aortic dissection. What is the most appropriate initial management of this patient?

options.label: A
options.text: Administer beta blocker and intensive blood pressure monitoring

questions.correct_answer: A. Administer beta blocker and intensive blood pressure monitoring

questions.text: A 38-year-old woman came with complaints of a slowly growing breast lump for the last 6 months. She had a history of a similar lump for which excision was done and medical and mammographic reports are not available. On examination, the lump was smooth, well-defined, mobile and with regular margins. The cytology and biopsy of the same were taken and are shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Identify the procedure done in the given image.

options.label: A
options.text: Bilateral Orchidectomy with bilateral inguinal node dissection

options.label: D
options.text: Total penectomy with inguinal node dissection

questions.correct_answer: D. Total penectomy with inguinal node dissection

questions.text: What does this image below indicate?
What is the structure marked with the Black arrow in the intraoperative image of spermatic cord of a patient with a congenital inguinal hernia?

The patient presented with headaches, repeated episodes of elevated blood pressure, and tachycardia. Urine shows elevated levels of vanillylmandelic acid. Her CT scan revealed a retroperitoneal tumor in the right lumbar region. Which among the following statements is true regarding the condition?

options.label: A
options.text: It can be associated with MEN 2A syndrome

options.label: B
options.text: It is commonly seen as as a bilateral condition

options.label: D
options.text: It is more commonly seen in children

questions.correct_answer: A. It can be associated with MEN 2A syndrome

questions.text: A 45-year-old male presents with acute retention of urine which is drained via the suprapubic route. A retrograde urethrogram was done and is shown below. What is the most appropriate management?

options.label: B
options.text: Urethral repair with graft from buccal mucosa

questions.correct_answer: B. Urethral repair with graft from buccal mucosa

questions.text: A patient diagnosed with GERD has no improvement after long-term medical therapy. He underwent surgical treatment for GERD. Identify the procedure.
Identify the diagnosis from the given CT scan.

A patient presented with dysuria and increased frequency of micturition. He has a history of recurrent urinary tract infections with Proteus species. The radiographic image is given below. Identify the calculi shown.
A woman noticed a neck swelling 2 months back. Clinical examination reveals a solitary nodule on the right side as shown. What is the most appropriate initial investigation for this patient?
questions.correct_answer: D. Serum TSH, T3 and T4

questions.text: Identify the ulcer shown in the image.

A child suffering from phenylketonuria was started on necessary dietary modifications but the neurological symptoms persisted. Phenylalanine hydroxylase levels in the serum are normal. Which of the following enzymes is likely to be deficient in this case?
A patient presented with multiple yellowish raised plaques on eyelids, xanthomas on the achilles tendon. What is the likely cause for the patient’s presentation?

A 32-year-old lady comes with complaints of erythematous scaly rash, loose stools, and cognitive dysfunction. The rash involved her forearm, neck, and face. She seems to have difficulty remembering things from the recent past. Her electrolytes are within normal range. She admits to having shifted to a corn-based diet due to economic reasons. Which of the following would improve her symptoms?

In the given Lineweaver-Burk plot, the blue line represents the action of an enzyme, and the red line represents the action of the same enzyme in the presence of an inhibitor. What is the type of inhibition shown here?
A child presented with recurrent abdominal pain, vomiting, and diarrhea following ingestion of milk-based products. Which enzyme is likely to be deficient?

A child presented to the OPD with complaints of fatigue and muscle weakness while exercising. Laboratory investigations found that LCFA oxidation was affected. A muscle biopsy was done which revealed the presence of fat vacuoles. What is the probable diagnosis?
Which micronutrient is most likely deficient in a patient with the radiographic findings given below along with anemia, neutropenia, depigmented hair and skin?
A homeless man comes with diarrhea, dementia, and dermatitis. He consumes alcohol occasionally. He admits to having ‘X’ as his staple diet. Which of the following is X most likely to be?
Which protein accumulation is seen in Alzheimer’s disease?

A mother came back home to see her child suffering from difficulty breathing. The child had contact with rotenone while trying to bathe their pet. The child was taken to the emergency department and she later passed away. Inhibition of which of the following enzymes was the likely cause of her death?

A large number of people who consumed cheap alcohol presented to the emergency department with abdominal pain, confusion, and decreased vision. Methyl alcohol level in blood was detected to be around 20 mg %. On assessment which of the following metabolites will be found in blood?
questions.correct_answer: B. Formic acid and lactic acid

questions.text: A patient with a gynecological malignancy is started on Methotrexate. Later she develops oral and gastric ulcers. Which nucleotide synthesis is affected in her?
A patient presents with symptoms of dermatitis, dementia, and cognitive decline. Which micronutrient deficiency is most likely responsible?
A patient presents with stridor after prolonged intubation. The endoscopic view is shown in the image below. What is the staging system for this condition?
Which of the following statements is true regarding an esophageal foreign body?

options.label: C
options.text: Most common site of impaction is at level of cricopharyngeus

options.label: D
options.text: One of the constrictions of the esopahgus is at the level of the right bronchus

questions.correct_answer: C. Most common site of impaction is at level of cricopharyngeus

questions.text: The patient complains of repeated episodes of crusting in the nose with occasional bleeding. She had undergone surgery for nasal obstruction four months back. On examination, the following finding is seen. Which surgery has the highest likelihood to result in this complication?
A 40-year-old woman presents with mild, progressive, bilateral hearing loss. A PTA showed the following findings. What is the most likely clinical finding in this patient?
In which procedure is the incision showed in the image used?
A 70-year-old man presents with unilateral hearing loss. On examination, a small perforation is noted on his left tympanic membrane. What will be the left-sided Rinne’s test finding in this patient?
A patient presented with recurrent swelling in his lower lip for the past 6 months as shown in the image. What is the diagnosis and treatment option for the patient?
What is true about the following position?

options.label: B
options.text: Ideal position for bougie insertion in emergencies

questions.text: This recovery position is appropriate for.

options.label: A
options.text: Unresponsive patient, pulse and breathing absent

options.label: B
options.text: Responsive patient, pulse and breathing present

options.label: C
options.text: Unresponsive patient, pulse and breating present

questions.correct_answer: C. Unresponsive patient, pulse and breating present

questions.text: For standards of ventilation, the widely quoted standard is that of De Chaumont who advocated a fresh air supply of 3000 cubic feet per person per hour. It is calculated based on which parameter?
At what pressure does the marked structure open?

A patient is undergoing implant surgery for his upper limb. On giving general anaesthesia he develops tachycardia, sudden raise in body temperature and rigidity of muscles. What drug is most likely to have caused this?
What is the procedure being done in the image?

3-month-old child was brought to the clinic with a history of difficulty in feeding and failure to thrive. On examination, the child is floppy, 48 cm in length and weighs 2.8 kg. There is generalized hypotonia, macroglossia and hepatomegaly. The chest x-ray of the child is given below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A newborn baby presented with a difficulty in breathing. Auscultation of the chest revealed gurgling sounds and heart sounds shifted to the right. The chest radiograph confirmed a congenital diaphragmatic hernia. Which among the following is the most common location for this condition?
A 2-year-old child presents to the emergency department with lethargy, difficulty feeding, and dehydration. His vitals are stable and his ECG is shown below. What is the next step in his management?
The method shown in the image is:

A woman presents with lower abdominal pain. Transvaginal ultrasound (TVS) performed over two days reveals a left adnexal cystic mass with a cogwheel appearance, incomplete septa, and no vascular flow on Doppler imaging. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the time taken for the embryo to travel from point 1 to 8?
A 45-year-old woman presented with menorrhagia. A hysterectomy was performed, and the specimen is shown below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A 42-year-old woman, P2L2, who had her last pregnancy 20 years ago, presents with heavy bleeding. A smooth, round, globular structure is observed on examination. On bimanual examination, the uterus is described as multiparous and firm, and the cervix admits one finger. What is the likely diagnosis?
An unmarried girl presents with amenorrhea and abdominal pain. On genital examination, she is found to have a softened cervix. What is this sign called?
A woman undergoing infertility treatment is found to have bilateral tubal blockage on hysterosalpingography. What is the most appropriate next step in her management?
A primigravida experienced precipitous labor while being transported In an ambulance. Upon arrival at the hospital, the given injury is observed. What type of injury is most likely?
Identify the forceps typically used for delivering the aftercoming head in a breech delivery.

A 30-year-old lady, G3P2 with 10 weeks intrauterine gestation comes to OPD with an Intra Uterine Contraceptive Device (IUCD) and the tail of the IUCD is noted to be protruding from the cervical os. The most appropriate course of action is?

options.label: A
options.text: Keep the IUCD in place and continue prophylactic antibiotics

options.label: B
options.text: Keep the IUCD in place without any treatment

options.label: C
options.text: Remove the IUCD immediately and continue pregnancy

options.label: D
options.text: Terminate the pregnancy because of high risk of infection

questions.correct_answer: C. Remove the IUCD immediately and continue pregnancy

questions.text: A woman presents with chronic lower abdominal pain that worsens during menstruation. Ultrasound reveals a right adnexal mass with homogeneous echoes. MRI shows a 4x5 cm T1 hyperintense lesion without fat suppression, while the T2 sequence demonstrates low signal intensity with characteristic dark shading. What is the most likely diagnosis?
A 30-year-old female, P2L2, presents with a mass per vaginum. On examination, infravaginal elongation of the cervix is noted. How will you treat this condition?

A 28-year-old P2L2 woman presents with complaints of a mass descending through the vagina and wishes to retain her fertility. She underwent an abdominal sling procedure with mesh placement. Which is the correct site of attachment of the mesh?

A woman who had a mediolateral episiotomy during normal labor presents with pain at the episiotomy site, which worsens during her menstrual periods. The findings noted on episiotomy site exploration are shown in the image below. What is the most likely diagnosis?

During a lower segment cesarean section (LSCS) for a patient with a breech presentation, following findings were noted as given in the image. On per vaginal examination, two cervices are felt. What is the most likely diagnosis?
Which of the following is not a contraindication to the procedure shown in the image?
A woman presents with lower abdominal pain. Ultrasound reveals a right adnexal mass with septations. Which tumor markers would be most appropriate to order in this case?
What is the most common site for tubal ligation and the reason for ligation at this site?

options.label: A
options.text: Ampulla; as it has more circular muscles than longitudinal muscles

options.label: B
options.text: Ampulla; as it is the widest part

options.label: C
options.text: Isthmus; as it has uniform muscle thickness

options.label: D
options.text: Isthmus; as it is the narrowest part

questions.correct_answer: C. Isthmus; as it has uniform muscle thickness

questions.text: A 21-year-old woman at 10 weeks of gestation, comes to you for medical termination of pregnancy. Which method would you prefer for this patient?
A 24-year-old woman at 34 weeks of gestation is admitted for preeclampsia with severe features, and you have administered MgSO4, as prophylaxis. Which of the following is not a part of monitoring?

options.label: A
options.text: Routine measurement of serum magnesium levels

options.label: D
options.text: Deep tendon reflexes should be present

questions.correct_answer: A. Routine measurement of serum magnesium levels

questions.text: A woman’s vaginal sample shows an abnormal Nugent’s score. What is the most likely diagnosis?
After ovulation, in which phase is the released egg arrested?

options.label: A
options.text: Primary oocyte with meiosis I completed

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary oocyte arrested in meiosis II

options.label: C
options.text: Primary oocyte arrested in meiosis I

options.label: D
options.text: Secondary oocyte with meiosis II completed

questions.correct_answer: B. Secondary oocyte arrested in meiosis II

questions.text: A 30-year-old man who was found dead was brought in for autopsy. The doctor notices a greyish-white waxy layer over the body with preserved facial features. Which of the following statements is true concerning adipocere formation?

options.label: A
options.text: It occurs in hot and dry temperatures

options.label: C
options.text: It is a type of body preservation with saponification of fats

options.label: D
options.text: Occurs within few hours of death

questions.correct_answer: C. It is a type of body preservation with saponification of fats

questions.text: A pregnant female comes to a gynaecologist, who sends her for USG. On USG, twin pregnancy was noted with about a one-month difference in the age of fetuses. Which of the following is true with regard to this patient?
A patient presented to the OPD with findings as shown below. Identify the type of poisoning in this patient.
The following findings were noted during the autopsy of a patient with a gunshot injury. What is the likely range of the gunshot?

A 32-year-old woman G3P2L2 in active labor experienced arrested labor at 8 cm dilation. After delivering via emergency cesarean section, she developed severe postpartum hemorrhage. Conservative measures failed, leading to an emergency hysterectomy. What are the medicolegal implications of this situation?

options.label: A
options.text: Patient could sue the doctor for removing her uterus

options.label: B
options.text: Hysterectomy was done as a life-saving procedure, so the doctor is legally protected

options.label: C
options.text: Consent can be taken from the patient on the OT table

options.label: D
options.text: Counseling of patient and attendants is not needed

questions.correct_answer: B. Hysterectomy was done as a life-saving procedure, so the doctor is legally protected

questions.text: A person comes to emergency after consumption of a substance, the form and dose of which is not known to the relatives. The patient has tachypnea and hypotension. On metabolic assessment, high anion gap metabolic acidosis is noted with hypocalcemia. What is the diagnosis?
In the case of drowning, following autopsy, an organism was isolated from the water present in the internal organs. Which of the following is true regarding the isolated organism?

options.label: A
options.text: Present only in the bone marrow

options.label: B
options.text: Dried outer wall contains silica and chlorophyll

options.label: C
options.text: It is a microscopic unicellular bacteria

options.label: D
options.text: It is not heat and acid resistant

questions.correct_answer: B. Dried outer wall contains silica and chlorophyll

questions.text: A 36-year-old man died following a RTA. The doctor informed the police officer and shifted the body to the mortuary. Autopsy in this case will be conducted at the request of:

A 19-year-old girl child came agitated to the emergency department after consuming some drug with a previous history of suicidal tendencies. The parents do not know the mode and route of the drug administered. She presented with tachycardia, tachypnea, diaphoresis, and dilated pupils. What is the likely drug administered?

A 10-year-old boy comes with visual disturbances and a headache. On imaging, he was found to have a suprasellar lesion. On biopsy and examination, the tumour exuded “black motor oil” like fluid. The MRI image is shown below. What is your likely diagnosis?

A 50-year-old woman presents with hearing loss in the left ear and episodic pulsatile tinnitus. On examination, there was a mass in the middle ear behind the tympanic membrane. A CT performed is as shown below. What is the probable diagnosis?

A 6-year-old child presented with seizures which subsided with injection Midazolam. Blood investigations and lumbar puncture studies were normal. MRI is done and the image is given below. What is the next best investigation of choice for further assessment?
Identify the condition shown in the image:
A patient came with a history of dyspnea. His CT scan is shown below. What is the likely diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Mediastinal mass with fat and calcification

options.label: D
options.text: This is characteristic of mediastinal Hydatid cyst

questions.correct_answer: C. Mediastinal mass with fat and calcification

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in the image:
Identify the following:
A 35-year-old female presented with complaints of fever for 5 days and there were no signs of meningitis. MRI with diffusion-weighted and contrast are shown. What is the most likely diagnosis?
What is the most likely diagnosis for a patient presenting with a bone tumor showing a sunburst appearance on imaging?
A 30-year-old man presents to the emergency room following a bike accident. Examination reveals the right upper limb in abduction and external rotation. What is the most probable diagnosis?
questions.correct_answer: C. Anterior Dislocation of the Shoulder

questions.text: A child sustained a fracture after a fall. An X-ray taken after fracture management is shown below. By which of the following mechanisms will fracture healing occur?

A 58-year-old female patient presents with a pathological fracture of the hip and femur. Her serum calcium and phosphate are increased. DEXA scan confirms decreased bone density. Which of the following parameters will increase in this condition?
A patient presents with sciatica and tenderness in the hamstring muscles. Which nerve supplies the hybrid muscle that is likely to be spared in this condition?
A patient suffered from RTA. After a few days, he had exaggerated right-sided extensor plantar reflex and knee jerk. What other finding would be seen?

options.label: C
options.text: Pain and temperature was lost in right leg

questions.correct_answer: A. Ankle clonus in right foot

questions.text: A 56-year-old woman presented with chronic lower back pain. MRI of the lower back shows the following findings. Identify the diagnosis.
A 10-year-old child fell down the stairs. An X-ray was done. Identify the structure injured as marked in the X-ray.
A 21-year-old patient with a history of a fracture had a cast applied. On removal of the cast, the following deformity was seen. What is the most likely cause of this deformity?
A fracture line passing through which of these will impair longitudinal growth of the bone?

patient complains of decreased sensation in the lateral three-and-a-half fingers on the palmar side of the right hand, along with difficulty moving the upper phalanx of the thumb. Examination reveals thenar atrophy. Which of the following structures, when affected, lead to this presentation?

A girl was referred to psychiatry by a plastic surgeon after repeatedly seeking full facial reconstruction. She complains of nonexistent dark spots on her face and insists she is ugly, frequently checking her reflection in mirrors and spoons. Despite her mother's reassurances, she remains fixated on surgery. What should the psychiatrist do?

options.label: C
options.text: Start her on selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors

questions.correct_answer: C. Start her on selective serotonin reuptake inhibitors

questions.text: 19-year-old presented to the psychiatry OPD. He has a charming persona and is well-composed and behaved in front of interviewers. His mother complains of him getting into fights and bunking classes, drinking alcohol and getting involved in police cases. What kind of personality disorder does he have?
If a child with ADHD goes untreated into adolescence, what is he most likely to develop?

A girl presented with multiple episodes of loss of consciousness. The episodes usually happen in the presence of the family members in the morning. She regains consciousness after 15 to 30 minutes and usually remembers the events during these episodes. There is no history of tongue bite or urinary incontinence. What should be done in this scenario?
In the Motivation model of health education, there are three stages for the adoption of new ideas. What is the third one other than awareness & motivation?

A 28-year-old woman, G4P3L3, with 1 neonatal death (NND) and 2 previous lower segment cesarean sections (LSCS), presents at term with an active genital herpes infection. What is the preferred mode of delivery?

A middle-aged man with a history of smoking for 20 years decides to quit this habit. However, he develops symptoms of tobacco withdrawal. Which of the following symptoms is unlikely to be seen in him?

The functioning of the thyroid involves the transport of iodine from the blood to the thyroid follicle. Iodine is transported from the follicle to the colloid. Which pump or channel is for transport of iodine from the follicle to the colloid?
Renal compensation in metabolic acidosis takes time because:

options.label: A
options.text: Initially the pH of tubular fluid increases

options.label: B
options.text: Low pH normally decreases bicarbonate excretion

options.label: C
options.text: It takes hours to days for kidney to synthesize enzymes that produce NH4+

options.label: D
options.text: Other ions in the tubule interfere with buffer action

questions.correct_answer: C. It takes hours to days for kidney to synthesize enzymes that produce NH4+

questions.text: The resting membrane potential (RMP) of the nerve is -70mV. Increased permeability of which ion is responsible for the RMP?
Which of the following is incorrect about iron metabolism?

options.label: A
options.text: Free serum iron is toxic to cells

options.label: B
options.text: Iron is stored in the body in the form of ferritin

options.label: C
options.text: Serum ferritin denotes the iron levels in the body

options.label: D
options.text: Iron is transported by binding with apoferritin

questions.correct_answer: D. Iron is transported by binding with apoferritin

questions.text: Arrange the sequence of steps involved at neuromuscular junction endplate potential.

options.label: A
options.text: Acetylcholine release – Calcium entry- Na+ entry

options.label: B
options.text: Calcium entry- Acetylcholine release- Na+ entry

options.label: C
options.text: Na+ entry – Calcium entry – Acetylcholine release

options.label: D
options.text: Na+ entry – Acetylcholine release – Calcium entry

questions.correct_answer: B. Calcium entry- Acetylcholine release- Na+ entry

questions.text: In which stage of sleep are K complex and sleep spindles seen?
What is the resting membrane potential of the sinoatrial (SA) node?
A scientist found that the latent period of muscle twitch is 10 ms and the contraction period is 40 ms. What is the tetanizing frequency (Hz)?
Where will you find the epithelium shown in the image?
During the examination of a patient, a professor asks the patient to invert his foot and points to a prominent tendon located behind the medial malleolus. Which tendon is being highlighted?

An elderly woman reports difficulty in buttoning her shirt and increased clumsiness during daily activities. On examination, she is unable to make an ‘O’ shape by opposing her thumb and index finger. Which of the following muscles is most likely involved?
A 52-year-old woman presented with weakness of shoulder movements. Investigations revealed quadrangular space syndrome. Which of the following nerve is likely to be affected?
The labyrinthine artery most commonly arises from which of the following arteries?
Which of the following cranial nerve nuclei is not a part of the special visceral afferent (SVA) column?
